tags.expression:
case({[.]Mode}
	, 0, 0.0 // Off
	, 1, tag({path}) // Auto
	, 2, 0.0 // Hand
	, 3, -1.0 // Faulted
	, 0.0 // Fallback
)

	, 0, 0.0 // Off

	, 3, -1.0 // Faulted
	, 0.0 // Fallback
)

tags.name: Flow
ValidStatus

eventScripts.script:
# Variables
	STATUS = ['Idle', 'Running', 'Maintenance', 'Downtime']
	PATH = "[.]%s/%s"
	
	# Check current value is valid
	if currentValue.value in STATUS:
		# Write current status start time
		system.tag.writeBlocking([PATH % ('StartTime', currentValue.value)], [system.date.now()])
	
	# Check previous value is valid
	if previousValue.value in STATUS:
		# Calculate total metric time
		startTime = system.tag.readBlocking([PATH % ('StartTime', previousValue.value)])[0].value
		
		# Calculate/Write total time if there is a start time
		if startTime:
			currentTime = system.tag.readBlocking([PATH % ('Metrics', previousValue.value)])[0].value
			totalTime = currentTime + system.date.secondsBetween(startTime, system.date.now())
			system.tag.writeBlocking([PATH % ('Metrics', previousValue.value)], [totalTime])
			
		# Clear previous status start time
		system.tag.writeBlocking([PATH % ('StartTime', previousValue.value)], [None])

# Get the new value of the tag
	value = currentValue.value
	
	# Define a dictionary that maps the numeric value to the corresponding state
	state_map = {
	    2: 0,
	    3: 1,
	    5: 2,
	    1: 2,
	    4: 2
	}
	
	# Get the corresponding state from the dictionary based on the value
	state = state_map.get(value, "UNKNOWN")  # Default to "UNKNOWN" if the value isn't found
	
	# Write the state to another memory tag (e.g., "[default]Line1/Status")
	system.tag.writeBlocking(["[default]LMW/U12/Cots_Aprons/Line-1/M0001/Status_Normalize_tag"], [state])
	system.tag.writeBlocking(["[default]Tenant/DEP0657305554e22fa94/CEL0658396916e354fc5/AST052013816c14e41a7/Raw/Status_Normalize_tag"], [state])

tags.name: MQTT Quickstart
tags.value: This folder contains tags tied to an MQTT Transmission 'Transmitter' configuration. Any tags added directly under the 'MQTT Tags' folder will be published to the configured MQTT Server. Additional information about how to modify this configuration to represent different tag structures can be found here: https://docs.chariot.io/display/CLD80/MQTT+Transmission+Transmitters+and+Tag+Trees

tags.name: OEE_Eight_hour
tags.query:
SELECT *
FROM mes_oee
WHERE MINUTE(t_stamp) = 0
AND HOUR(t_stamp) IN (0, 8, 16)
ORDER BY t_stamp;

tags.name: OEE_hourly
tags.query:
SELECT oee
FROM mes_oee
WHERE TIME_FORMAT(t_stamp, '%i') = '00'
ORDER BY t_stamp DESC
LIMIT 1;
